poem:
Title: The Economy's Echo

DFS whispers of sullen sofas,
Wickes warns of the costly chaos,
Demand, once a robust tide, now ebbs;
In this, the pattern of living webs.
Weakened significantly, Eh?
Less profits in the light of day,
yet beyond the plywood and the throw,
Lives made less by what we forgo.
This is not a lament to those who sell,
but to consumers in living hell.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "DFS and Wickes report weak demand for high-cost household goods The furniture retailer DFS and the DIY group Wickes have warned of weak demand for high-cost household goods as consumers continue to cut spending in the cost of living crisis. DFS, which specialises in selling sofas, said annual profits would be £10m lower than previously hoped and sales would come in up to £65m below expectations, adding that demand had “weakened significantly” over the past". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
